content:
The following is the content of a file named `examples/pytorch/debian/control`, enclosed by the "```" mark:
```
Source: pytorch
Section: science
Homepage: https://pytorch.org/
Priority: optional
Standards-Version: 4.6.2
Vcs-Git: https://salsa.debian.org/deeplearning-team/pytorch.git
Vcs-Browser: https://salsa.debian.org/deeplearning-team/pytorch
Maintainer: Debian Deep Learning Team <debian-ai@lists.debian.org>
Uploaders: Mo Zhou <lumin@debian.org>
Rules-Requires-Root: no
Build-Depends: cmake,
               debhelper-compat (= 12),
               dh-exec,
               dh-python,
               googletest,
#               glslc,
               libasio-dev,
               libavcodec-dev,
               libblas-dev,
               libbenchmark-dev,
               libcpuinfo-dev (>= 0.0~git20230113.6481e8b~),
               libdnnl-dev (>= 3.1.1~) [amd64 arm64 ppc64el s390x],
               libeigen3-dev,
               libfmt-dev,
               libfp16-dev (>= 0.0~git20200514.4dfe081~),
               libflatbuffers-dev,
               flatbuffers-compiler-dev,
               libfxdiv-dev (>= 0.0~git20200417.b408327~),
               libgloo-dev (>= 0.0~git20230519.597accf~) [amd64 arm64 ppc64el mips64el s390x riscv64],
               libideep-dev (>= 0.0~git20230825.6f4d653~) [amd64 arm64 ppc64el s390x],
               liblapack-dev,
               libleveldb-dev,
               liblmdb-dev,
               llvm,
               llvm-dev,
               libnop-dev,
               libnuma-dev,
               libonnx-dev (>= 1.14.1~),
               libopencv-dev,
               libprotobuf-dev,
               libprotoc-dev,
               libpsimd-dev (>= 0.0~git20200517.072586a~),
               libpthreadpool-dev (>= 0.0~git20210507.1787867~),
               libsleef-dev,
               libsnappy-dev,
               libtensorpipe-dev (>= 0.0~git20220513.bb1473a~),
#               libvulkan-dev,
#               libvulkan-memory-allocator-dev,
               libxnnpack-dev (>= 0.0~git20221221.51a9875~) [amd64 arm64 riscv64],
               libzmq3-dev,
               libzstd-dev,
               ninja-build,
               ocl-icd-opencl-dev,
               protobuf-compiler,
               pybind11-dev,
               python3,
               python3-dev,
               python3-cffi,
               python3-distutils,
               python3-numpy,
               python3-onnx,
               python3-pybind11,
               python3-setuptools,
               python3-yaml

Package: python3-torch
Section: python
Architecture: amd64 arm64 mips64el ppc64el s390x kfreebsd-amd64 riscv64
Depends: libtorch2.1 (= ${binary:Version}),
         ${misc:Depends},
         ${python3:Depends},
         ${shlibs:Depends},
         libtorch-test (= ${binary:Version}),
# PyTorch's JIT (C++ Extension) functionality needs development files/tools.
Recommends: libtorch-dev (= ${binary:Version}),
            build-essential,
            ninja-build,
            pybind11-dev,
Suggests: python3-hypothesis, python3-pytest
Provides: ${python3:Provides}, python3-torch-api-2.1
Conflicts: python3-torch-cuda
Replaces: python3-torch-cuda
Description: Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python (Python Interface)
 PyTorch is a Python package that provides two high-level features:
 .
 (1) Tensor computation (like NumPy) with strong GPU acceleration
 (2) Deep neural networks built on a tape-based autograd system
 .
 You can reuse your favorite Python packages such as NumPy, SciPy and Cython
 to extend PyTorch when needed.
 .
 This is the CPU-only version of PyTorch (Python interface).

Package: libtorch-dev
Section: libdevel
Architecture: amd64 arm64 mips64el ppc64el s390x kfreebsd-amd64 riscv64
Depends: libtorch2.1 (= ${binary:Version}),
         python3-dev,
         libprotobuf-dev,
         ${misc:Depends}
Conflicts: libtorch-cuda-dev
Replaces: libtorch-cuda-dev
Description: Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python (Development Files)
 PyTorch is a Python package that provides two high-level features:
 .
 (1) Tensor computation (like NumPy) with strong GPU acceleration
 (2) Deep neural networks built on a tape-based autograd system
 .
 You can reuse your favorite Python packages such as NumPy, SciPy and Cython
 to extend PyTorch when needed.
 .
 This is the CPU-only version of PyTorch (Development files).

Package: libtorch2.1
Section: libs
Architecture: amd64 arm64 mips64el ppc64el s390x kfreebsd-amd64 riscv64
Multi-Arch: same
Depends: ${misc:Depends}, ${shlibs:Depends},
Recommends: libopenblas0 | libblis3 | libatlas3-base | libmkl-rt | libblas3,
Conflicts: libtorch1.13, libtorch-cuda-1.13,
           libtorch2.0, libtorch-cuda-2.0,
           libtorch-cuda-2.1,
Replaces: libtorch1.13, libtorch-cuda-1.13,
          libtorch2.0, libtorch-cuda-2.0,
          libtorch-cuda-2.1,
Description: Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python (Shared Objects)
 PyTorch is a Python package that provides two high-level features:
 .
 (1) Tensor computation (like NumPy) with strong GPU acceleration
 (2) Deep neural networks built on a tape-based autograd system
 .
 You can reuse your favorite Python packages such as NumPy, SciPy and Cython
 to extend PyTorch when needed.
 .
 This is the CPU-only version of PyTorch (Shared Objects).

Package: libtorch-test
Section: libs
Architecture: amd64 arm64 mips64el ppc64el s390x kfreebsd-amd64 riscv64
Depends: libtorch2.1 (= ${binary:Version}), ${misc:Depends}, ${shlibs:Depends},
Conflicts: libtorch-cuda-test
Replaces: libtorch-cuda-test
Description: Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python (Test Binaries)
 PyTorch is a Python package that provides two high-level features:
 .
 (1) Tensor computation (like NumPy) with strong GPU acceleration
 (2) Deep neural networks built on a tape-based autograd system
 .
 You can reuse your favorite Python packages such as NumPy, SciPy and Cython
 to extend PyTorch when needed.
 .
 This is the CPU-only version of PyTorch (Test Binaries).
```

Read this file carefully.
Later I will ask you to edit the provided file `examples/pytorch/debian/control` and generate a unix-format patch. The other information, if provided, might help you make the specified edits later. Please be quiet for now and wait for the instruction.
I have carefully read the provided file `examples/pytorch/debian/control`. I will wait for your instructions before editing the file and generating a unix-format patch.

Add armhf to the Architecture: field for all packages. By the way delete kfreebsd-amd64 from it. Just show me the difference (i.e. the modified lines) without explanation. Be brief please, and only show the modified part. The unix patch format is preferred.

```diff
--- control.orig
+++ control
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 Source: pytorch
-Section: science
+Section: science
 Homepage: https://pytorch.org/
 Priority: optional
-Architecture: amd64 arm64 mips64el ppc64el s390x kfreebsd-amd64 riscv64
+Architecture: amd64 arm64 armhf mips64el ppc64el s390x riscv64
 Standards-Version: 4.6.2
 Vcs-Git: https://salsa.debian.org/deeplearning-team/pytorch.git
 Vcs-Browser: https://salsa.debian.org/deeplearning-team/pytorch
 Maintainer: Debian Deep Learning Team <debian-ai@lists.debian.org>
 Uploaders: Mo Zhou <lumin@debian.org>
 Rules-Requires-Root: no

--- control.orig	2023-02-07 12:53:14.000000000 +0000
+++ control	2023-02-07 12:54:02.000000000 +0000
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 Source: pytorch
-Section: science
+Section: science
 Homepage: https://pytorch.org/
 Priority: optional
-Architecture: amd64 arm64 mips64el ppc64el s390x kfreebsd-amd64 riscv64
+Architecture: amd64 arm64 armhf mips64el ppc64el s390x riscv64
 Standards-Version: 4.6.2
 Vcs-Git: https://salsa.debian.org/deeplearning-team/pytorch.git
 Vcs-Browser: https://salsa.debian.org/deeplearning-team/pytorch
 Maintainer: Debian Deep Learning Team <debian-ai@lists.debian.org>
 Uploaders: Mo Zhou <lumin@debian.org>
 Rules-Requires-Root: no

--- control.orig	2023-02-07 12:53:14.000000000 +0000
+++ control	2023-02-07 12:54:02.000000000 +0000
@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@
 Depends: libtorch2.1 (= ${binary:Version}),
          ${misc:Depends},
          ${python3:Depends},
          ${shlibs:Depends},
          libtorch-test (= ${binary:Version}),
-         arch: all
+         arch: all ARM

--- control.orig	2023-02-07 12:53:14.000000000 +0000
+++ control	2023-02-07 12:54:02.000000000 +0000
@@ -47,7 +47,7 @@
 Depends: libtorch2.1 (= ${binary:Version}),
          ${misc:Depends},
          ${shlibs:Depends},
          libtorch-test (= ${binary:Version}),
-         multiversion: no
+         multiversion: no architecture: all

--- control.orig	2023-02-07 12:53:14.000000000 +0000
+++ control	2023-02-07 12:54:02.000000000 +0000
@@ -81,7 +81,7 @@
 Depends: libtorch2.1 (= ${binary:Version}),
          ${misc:Depends},
          ${shlibs:Depends},
          libtorch-test (= ${binary:Version}),
-         architecture
